frontmatter.title: Anticipate likely scenarios
frontmatter.description: If the situation gets out of control, it's often because of earlier mistakes. Play through possible scenarios mentally ahead of time, anticipate the most likely scenarios, and then repeat the process better the next time.

frontmatter.title: Encourage socialization
frontmatter.description: Good connections are hard to come by and those opportunities shouldn't be put off for the 'right' time. Make time. Encourage others.

frontmatter.title: Momentary perspective shifts
frontmatter.description: Everyone comes to a situation with a different mindset, and often different goals in mind. Seek other perspectives momentarily and realize there's more than one method.

frontmatter.title: Filtered perspectives
frontmatter.description: There's no true unbiased approach. Keep others' perspectives in mind and work to adjust own filters to better match.

frontmatter.title: Positive commonalities
frontmatter.description: Seemingly disparate groups often shared some common interests. Identify positive commonalities across traditional demographic groups.

frontmatter.title: Identify common feelings
frontmatter.description: Division is the easy way. Go beyond, find commonalities, build new connections.

frontmatter.title: Communicating the positive aspects of technology
frontmatter.description: It wasn't long ago that tech was overly revered. It's now overly criticized. Tech brings change, good and bad. Find good technology that enables others.

frontmatter.title: Set clear guidelines
frontmatter.description: It's not right to expect others to understand boundaries. The stakes are high and bad habits lead to unintended consequences.

frontmatter.title: Find commonalities and ask questions
frontmatter.description: Ask questions. Be interested in the commonalities.

frontmatter.title: Overt positive experiences
frontmatter.description: Recognize frustration. Strive for better. Accept what is. Find the best in what is now. Overly communicate the positive. s
